wiki.summary: Vincent is a song by German singer Sarah Connor. It was released on April 5, 2019 by Polydor as the lead single of her ninth studio album Herz Kraft Werke. The song was written by Connor with Peter Plate and Ulf Leo Sommer. The song “Vincent” deals with confusion and pain in love. Among others, it tells the story of Vincent, who realizes that he is gay and has fallen in love with a man. He turns to his mother and receives support from her. The song also portrays Linda and Ben, who are described as a “perfect couple”, but break up. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: Vincent is a song by German singer Sarah Connor. It was released on April 5, 2019 by Polydor as the lead single of her ninth studio album Herz Kraft Werke. The song was written by Connor with Peter Plate and Ulf Leo Sommer. The song “Vincent” deals with confusion and pain in love. Among others, it tells the story of Vincent, who realizes that he is gay and has fallen in love with a man. He turns to his mother and receives support from her. The song also portrays Linda and Ben, who are described as a “perfect couple”, but break up. Finally, the song revisits Vincent’s situation: He has “two children and a strong man”. Connor wrote the song after she learned from a friend that her son was gay. The name Vincent is fictional. Connor told the taz that Vincent was “the most important song [she] ever made”. Some radio stations do not play the song because of the line “Vincent can’t get it up when he thinks of girls”, which starts the song. Others play the song without this first line, but many stations broadcast the song uncensored. Idolator called the song an “uplifting pop anthem”. The song received positive reviews from critics and fans, and reached the top ten in Germany and Austria. It was also certified platinum in both countries, as well as in Switzerland. It was nominated for the 1Live Krone award for Best Single and the Echo award for Hit of the Year. The music video, directed by Justin Izumi, shows Connor and various people expressing their emotions through dance. The video has over 49 million views on YouTube. Read more on Last.fm.
